item.title: Export a MySQL database using the command line.
item.description: Sometimes it’s easier to just drop to the command line then browse for fancy tools like phpMyAdmin. This is useful, especially for quick jobs. mysqldump -u user -ppassword your_database > database_backup.sql Of course you need to replace: user - mysql username password - the password your_database - the database you want to backup Adding -h host.domain.com would allow to backup a remote mysql database from YOUR shell, something like this:
